page.title: 07Local new stories
page.content: Last week in Avebury some happy faces were seen in the antique shop because Mrs Angela Sumbler who with her husband runs it,won Â£20,000 0n The Sun bingo game.Mr and Mrs Sumbler have a daughter Nicola who attends the local primary school. On 4th May 1985 the Church of St James Avebury celebrated the 900th anniversary of the first incumbent. The Church itself dates back to Saxon times and the local primary school organised a Saxon day to commemorate the occasion. The children made a banner to hang in the Church and, dressed in costumes down through the ages celebrated with a procession a playlet and a Saxon fair. This event went went down well within the village and also among the tourist visitors on the day.
